parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural

str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
(a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A prolonged form of a primary verb; to look closely at, i.e. perceive; by extension to visit.
A reed; a reed-pen, reed-staff, measuring rod. Or uncertain affinity; a reed; by implication, a pen.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From salos; to waver, i.e. Agitate, rock, topple or destroy; figuratively, to disturb, incite.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
The wind; fig: applied to empty doctrines. From the base of aer; wind; by implication, quarters.
